page.title: 09MR.HURRELL'S MORNING.
page.content: My day begins at 6.30 when the alarm goes off. My wife Jean gets up to make the tea for us and our two children (James 9 and Joanna 7). We all breakfast together on cereals and toast at about 7.30 (This may be the only time during the day that we are together as a family so it is important to us).I leave our home in Picklescott at 7.45 to drive the 12 miles to school, arriving at around 8.15 I prepare the 'Daily Dozen'( 12 maths problems) and generally get set up for the day.At 9.00 the children come in and start 'DD' while we register.We work through until 10.15 when we have assembly followed by break time until 10.55.We break for lunch at 12.00 to 1.15, when we start the afternoon session.
